speaker: Heartwood
lines: The market folds itself back into the trees; only the stump remains and even it is more suggestion than wood.
You set the twig bundle on the scale. The other pan fills with birdsong and stops just shy of even.
A hand like bark and a voice like rain offer you what the forest thinks you meant to ask.
Roots rise just enough to trip your doubt and then settle, satisfied.
The air tastes of sap and the first cut of spring.
You feel the path arrange itself under you for the walk back you haven't started.
The forest keeps your name the way a pocket keeps a stone.
It returns something that fits your hand like a memory finally behaving.

give_item.name: Thornbow
give_item.description: A bow grown, not carved; it remembers which way to bend

give_item.name: Heart-Root Blade
give_item.description: A blade with grain; it favors the patient

give_item.name: Verdant Word
give_item.description: Speak and the green leans to listen
